column5: I'm thinking about adding a voltmeter at the bow of my boat to monitor my trolling motor battery voltage.  Anyone have any recommendations as to make or model?  Thanks, Dean.
I go by what my graph tells me. I'm not sure how accurate it is, but its close enough for me.  S.

I use my graph also, but it's hooked up to the starting battery. Up front I have a cheaper graph without this function hooked up to a second trolling motor battery...hence the need for a seperate voltmeter.

I got a battery meter from Cabela's that monitors both of my batteries. It reads in percentages and changes every 5 seconds while monitoring each battery. They had it on sale for $14.95 and it came with about $10 worth of wire. Definitely worth having one.
